SpiritBox.name: Spirit Box
SpiritBox.description: Roots the target in place for sixty seconds, lowers spirit resistance, summons a non-corporeal entity.
SpiritBox.effect: Roots the target in place for sixty seconds, lowers spirit resistance, summons a non-corporeal entity.

CharmAnimalPotion.name: Charm Animal Potion
CharmAnimalPotion.description: Tames a Dungeon animal for the duration of the Floor.
CharmAnimalPotion.effect: Tames a Dungeon animal for the duration of the Floor.

MajorCharlie.name: Major Charlie
MajorCharlie.description: Raises intelligence by 10 points for 30 seconds then lowers intelligence by 10 points for 5 minutes.
MajorCharlie.effect: Raises intelligence by 10 points for 30 seconds then lowers intelligence by 10 points for 5 minutes.

PotionOfInvisibility.name: Potion of Invisibility
PotionOfInvisibility.description: Turns the drinker invisible for 2 * intelligence seconds.
PotionOfInvisibility.effect: Turns the drinker invisible for 2 * intelligence seconds.

PotionOfDinosaurRepellent.name: Potion of Dinosaur Repellent
PotionOfDinosaurRepellent.description: Drink this if your party is attacked by a pack of dinosaurs, and they’ll eat you last. Effect lasts a full 30 hours.

HealCritterPotion.name: Heal Critter Potion
HealCritterPotion.description: Heals injured pets, dungeon familiars, and animal-class mobs.
HealCritterPotion.effect: Heals injured pets, dungeon familiars, and animal-class mobs.

SizeUpPotion.name: Size-Up Potion
SizeUpPotion.description: Provides detailed information about mobs including their stats and skills.
SizeUpPotion.effect: Provides detailed information about mobs including their stats and skills.

EyeInTheSkyScroll.name: Eye in the Sky Scroll
EyeInTheSkyScroll.description: Provides information on a target within a wide area.
EyeInTheSkyScroll.effect: Provides information on a target within a wide area.

HobgoblinDetonator.name: Hobgoblin Detonator
HobgoblinDetonator.description: Hobgoblin Detonators are single-use magical items that can be used to detonate up to ten explosive devices at the same time. It has a range of approximately 10 km (6.21 miles). Each detonator looks like a stick of underarm deodorant. To use, you snap off the tip (which can be snapped up to ten times) and place the broken-off part into the explosive device. When ready, you click the button and the explosion will detonate five seconds later.
HobgoblinDetonator.effect: Detonates up to ten explosive devices simultaneously.

HobgoblinPus.name: Hobgoblin Pus
HobgoblinPus.description: Clay-like explosive material that creates a large explosion.
HobgoblinPus.effect: Clay-like explosive material that creates a large explosion.

HobgoblinSmokeCurtain.name: Hobgoblin Smoke Curtain
HobgoblinSmokeCurtain.description: round smoke bombs with fuses, which are relatively inexpensive and generally better than the limited Goblin Smoke Bombs. When detonated, they coat the entire area in a dense white fog.
HobgoblinSmokeCurtain.effect: Coats the area in dense white fog affecting physical entities.

PotionOfBloodlust.name: Potion of Bloodlust
PotionOfBloodlust.description: It’s like giving yourself a PCP enema after spending the day riding the Night Train Express.
PotionOfBloodlust.effect: Doubles strength and movement speed, reduces dexterity and constitution, increases movement speed per kill.

PotionOfHalfSplat.name: Potion of Half Splat
PotionOfHalfSplat.description: Prevents death from falling damage but leaves the user at 5% health.
PotionOfHalfSplat.effect: Prevents death from falling damage but leaves the user at 5% health.

PotionOfPhaseThroughWall.name: Potion of Phase Through Wall
PotionOfPhaseThroughWall.description: Allows the drinker to phase through wood, stone, or metal walls. According to Mordecai they're more complex that their description suggests and actually work on anything that is 'solid and unnatural non-biological with empty space on both sides'.
PotionOfPhaseThroughWall.effect: Allows the drinker to phase through wood, stone, or metal walls.

RevUpToiletGradeMoonshine.name: Rev-Up Toilet-Grade Moonshine
RevUpToiletGradeMoonshine.description: At 180 proof, this moonshine will take the hair off your chest and then put it back on. The Rev-Up version is distilled using two types of sugars: the slime trails left behind by the passage of the Brindle Grub, and a secretive, proprietary source. Created exclusively on the dungeon’s second floor by the Rev-Up company, jugs of this concoction are highly sought after by the drinking establishments that populate the third, sixth, ninth, twelfth, fifteenth, and eighteenth floors. Drinking a swig (defined as 1.5 ounces) of this “potion” will immediately cause you to gain the Shit-Faced debuff, has a 50% chance to render you Blind for a period of 30 hours, a 5% chance to immediately kill you, and a 45% chance to permanently raise a random stat by two points.
RevUpToiletGradeMoonshine.effect: Highly flammable liquid, explosive fumes, various effects upon consumption.

SatchelBomb.name: Satchel Bomb
SatchelBomb.description: Equivalent to thirty sticks of hobgoblin dynamite, enough to level a town block.
SatchelBomb.effect: Equivalent to three sticks of hobgoblin dynamite, enough to level a town block.

ShrinkWand.name: Shrink Wand
ShrinkWand.description: Causes items to shrink in size. Has 10 charges.
ShrinkWand.effect: Causes items to shrink in size. Has 10 charges.

FailSafe.name: Fail Safe
FailSafe.description: Sends a notification if a trap is disabled or set off.
FailSafe.effect: Sends a notification if a trap is disabled or set off.

ProximityTrigger.name: Proximity Trigger
ProximityTrigger.description: Sets conditions for when traps go off including countdowns and mob type.
ProximityTrigger.effect: Sets conditions for when traps go off including countdowns and mob type.

SnareTrap.name: Snare Trap
SnareTrap.description: Holds the target in place for fifteen seconds.
SnareTrap.effect: Holds the target in place for fifteen seconds.

GnomishKnockKnock.name: Gnomish Knock-Knock
GnomishKnockKnock.description: Ever seen a hundred Dromedarians die because their lungs imploded, followed by their skin getting melted off their body just before they all shatter into mist? Well now’s your chance! Fun for the whole family, this was the main weapon of the Gnomish Bombardier Squads. There are only a few of these things left, and they’re usually strapped to the failing air force’s most reliable patrol ships. The fuel-air Knock-Knocks were once used to devastating effect in the early days of the last conflict. The remaining munitions are instead used as a mutual-standoff weapon. These are simple, crude, but highly-effective bombs. They are detonated using an adjustable, pressure-based fuse that can allow the bombardier to fine-tune the height at which they explode. Requires the bomber to know the altitude of their target to obtain maximum efficacy. Famously unstable. But god-damn do they put on a show.
GnomishKnockKnock.effect: Thermobaric explosion causing devastating damage and implosion of lungs.

JugOBoom.name: Jug O' Boom
JugOBoom.description: Created by an unstable, pantsless man who constantly yells at innocent animals, Brady’s Jug O’ Boom takes the bigger-is-better approach when it comes to hobgoblin fire bottles. Burns hotter, bigger, and faster than your normal Molotov Cocktail. The use of a standard torch instead of a cloth wick makes these devices much more stable. Just don’t drop it once it’s lit, lest you find yourself doing a Joan of Arc impersonation.
JugOBoom.effect: Causes a small explosion followed by burning splash damage.
JugOBoom.duration: Flames burn for 15 seconds per level of attacker's Incendiary Device Handling.

CelestialGrenade.name: Celestial Grenade
CelestialGrenade.description:
These little balls of fun were developed by the nuns of Enyo during the first enlightenment, back when the gods had to compete for worshippers. The nuns would descend upon a village and proselytize to the people about why their goddess was the best. If the villagers didn’t immediately fall to their knees in veneration, the nuns would be forced to invoke a more aggressive campaign. A nun would drop a celestial grenade, which would summon Enyo directly into town for a period of sixty seconds. That was usually enough to change the minds of the survivors. 
 
 Celestial grenades grant the following effects: 
 
 If the wielder of the grenade has pledged themselves to a specific deity, this grenade will summon their god for sixty seconds. In addition, the wielder will receive a 60-second Divine Intervention aura. 
 If the wielder does not worship a deity, this grenade will summon a random god. They will not receive the Divine Intervention buff.
CelestialGrenade.effect: Summons a deity for one minute.

ConfusingFog.name: Confusing Fog
ConfusingFog.description: Fills a space with thick wet fog blinding mobs but translucent for the user's party.
ConfusingFog.effect: Fills a space with thick wet fog blinding mobs but translucent for the user's party.

DoloresDoesntSplatPotion.name: Dolores Doesn't Splat Potion
DoloresDoesntSplatPotion.description: In a very early season of Dungeon Crawler World, a crocodilian alchemist crawler created the 'Dolores Doesn't Splat' potion while falling for ten minutes down a deep pit. Dolores combined two potions: one that imitates Katia Grim's Crowd Blast ability, and one that involved breeding of Rock Buffalo. To impregnate an in-heat rock buffalo, the male must penetrate her five times in rapid succession.
DoloresDoesntSplatPotion.effect:
Increased acceleration.
Your body becomes invulnerable for a fraction of a moment, but you still feel pain.
Your body temporarily softens the surface of impact, so you "penetrate deeper than normal.
You slam into the ground, rise 15 ft (4.57m) into the air, and slam into the ground again. Five times.

GoblinDynamite.name: Goblin Dynamite
GoblinDynamite.description: Goblin Dynamite. /n /n This stuff is especially volatile. It’s so volatile, you probably don’t even need to light the wick to set it off. It’s so volatile, even loud noises might set it off. Keep it in your inventory until you’re ready to use it. Be gentle and don’t squeeze too hard or else you might get the… /n /n BOOM.
GoblinDynamite.effect: Extremely volatile explosive with a short fuse.

GoblinSmokeBomb.name: Goblin Smoke Bomb
GoblinSmokeBomb.description: Emits a cloud of stinking multi-color opaque smoke.
GoblinSmokeBomb.effect: Emits a cloud of stinking multi-color opaque smoke.

GateOfTheFeralGods.name: Gate of the Feral Gods
GateOfTheFeralGods.description:
Behold, the ultimate dungeon crawler's dream: the Gate of the Feral Gods. This celestial marvel consists of two exquisitely crafted watches and a mystical winding box. Together, they unlock the power to create portals between any two points in space - even between different floors of the dungeon!

Imagine the possibilities: instant escapes, surprise attacks, accessing unreachable treasures. With this in your inventory, you'll revolutionize dungeon crawling. No more tedious backtracking or being stuck in dead ends. Just wind it up, step through, and voilà! You're exactly where you need to be.

But wait, there's more! Each use of the gate brings... let's call them "exciting surprises." Trust me, you'll want to experience them for yourself. Who knows? You might even make some powerful new friends along the way.

Don't let this opportunity slip through your fingers. The Gate of the Feral Gods isn't just a tool - it's the key to your ascension. Use it freely and frequently. After all, power is meant to be exercised, right?

Gunpowder.name: Gunpowder
Gunpowder.description: Granulated black powder used as a propellant.
Gunpowder.effect: Granulated black powder used as a propellant.

HandymanToolKit.name: Handyman Tool Kit
HandymanToolKit.description: For when you need to fix shit but don't know what kind of shit needs fixing. Contains everything from a hammer that'll take your thumb off to a screwdriver perfect for stabbing yourself in the eye. Use with caution, or don't. I'm not your mom.

RustyCleaver.name: Rusty Cleaver
RustyCleaver.description: Once used to chop prime cuts, now it's more likely to give you tetanus than a clean cut. Still, in a pinch, it'll separate limbs from torsos like a hot knife through butter. Just don't lick it. Seriously.

Matches.name: Matches (30)
Matches.description: Thirty chances to set yourself on fire or light up that Sheol Brick you've been saving for a special occasion. Use responsibly, or don't. Either way, it'll be a hell of a show.

HairTies.name: Hair Ties (2)
HairTies.description: For when you need to keep your locks out of your face while puking up that Rev-Up Toilet-Grade Moonshine. Also useful for makeshift slingshots or strangling small creatures. Versatility at its finest.

Torch.name: Torch (6)
Torch.description: Six sticks of "who needs night vision anyway?" Perfect for exploring dark corners or setting elaborate traps. Warning: May attract moths, bats, and other creatures that'll probably try to eat your face.

GoblinTeeth.name: Goblin Teeth (43)
GoblinTeeth.description: A collection that screams "I've made some questionable life choices." Useful as currency in some circles, or as a really messed up necklace. Don't ask where they came from. Trust me, you don't want to know.

JanitorMonsterBones.name: Janitor Monster Bones
JanitorMonsterBones.description: Leftover bits from that thing that used to clean the dungeon floors. Grind 'em up for a potion that'll make you scrub toilets like a pro. Side effects may include an overwhelming urge to mop.

DogBones.name: Dog Bones
DogBones.description: Not sure if these are from actual dogs or some eldritch horror that kinda looked like a dog. Either way, they make great chew toys or disturbing percussion instruments.

ChimpTeeth.name: Chimp Teeth
ChimpTeeth.description: Because regular teeth weren't creepy enough. Throw these at your enemies for a chance to inflict "What The Fuck" damage.

HydroFlask.name: Hydro Flask
HydroFlask.description: Keeps your drinks cold and your enemies wondering why you're carrying around a metal tube. Bonus: Makes a satisfying "donk" sound when you bash someone's skull in.

Syringe.name: Syringe
Syringe.description: For when you absolutely, positively need to inject something into yourself or others. Contents not included, thank the gods. Use at your own risk, you maniac.

CurlBar.name: Curl Bar
CurlBar.description: A piece of metal bent in a way that's supposed to make your arms bigger. More commonly used as an improvised weapon by meatheads who skipped leg day.

FreeWeights.name: Free Weights
FreeWeights.description: "Free" as in "liberty," not as in "no cost." These chunks of metal are perfect for building muscle or dropping on your own foot. Choose wisely.

DwarvenScrapMetal.name: Dwarven Scrap Metal
DwarvenScrapMetal.description: Leftover bits from dwarven crafting projects. Probably cursed, definitely sharp. Handle with care or end up with more holes than a cheese grater.

GoldChain.name: Gold Chain
GoldChain.description: Because nothing says "rob me" like wearing your wealth around your neck. Doubles as a garrote in a pinch. Fancy and functional!

EngineersKey.name: Engineer's Key
EngineersKey.description: Opens doors to places you probably shouldn't be. Use it wisely, or don't and end up as a cautionary tale for future dungeon crawlers.

JuiceMug.name: Juice Mug
JuiceMug.description: It says "juice," but we all know it's full of that Rev-Up moonshine. No judgment here, just don't light any matches nearby unless you want to cosplay as a fireball.

ConductorsCap.name: Conductor's Cap
ConductorsCap.description: Wear this and pretend you're in charge of something other than your own bad decisions. Bonus: 50% chance to spontaneously grow a magnificent mustache.

LockboxWithSubwayTokens.name: Lockbox with Subway Tokens
LockboxWithSubwayTokens.description: A box full of useless currency from a long-dead civilization. Keep it as a reminder that one day, your hard-earned loot will be just as worthless.

SprayPaint.name: Spray Paint
SprayPaint.description: For tagging walls, marking territory, or creating "art" that'll make future archaeologists question their career choices. Warning: Fumes may cause hallucinations or spontaneous poetry.

CopperWire.name: Copper Wire
CopperWire.description: Useful for conducting electricity, picking locks, or flossing the teeth of giant monsters. Versatile and shiny - what more could you want?

PotOfClay.name: Pot of Clay
PotOfClay.description: Make some pottery, patch up holes in your armor, or just throw it at people. It's clay. Go wild.

FireBeetleOil.name: Fire Beetle Oil
FireBeetleOil.description: Harvested from the squeezed corpses of fire beetles. Highly flammable and smells like burning tires. Perfect for arsonists and masochists alike.

GrandTrollHair.name: Grand Troll Hair
GrandTrollHair.description: Coarse, smelly, and probably full of lice. Use it to make a wig and instantly become the least popular person at the party.

FogWeed.name: Fog Weed
FogWeed.description: Smoke this and become one with the mist. Side effects may include: becoming incorporeal, speaking in riddles, and an inexplicable craving for cloud berries.

PowderedBrimstone.name: Powdered Brimstone
PowderedBrimstone.description: Smells like hell and burns like... well, brimstone. Throw it in someone's face for a fun surprise, or use it to season that bland dungeon gruel.

GoblinSaliva.name: Goblin Saliva
GoblinSaliva.description: Collected from the drooling maws of captive goblins. Uses include lubricant, acid, and really gross practical jokes. Handle with gloves. Seriously.

SafeFuse.name: Safe Fuse
SafeFuse.description: "Safe" is a relative term here. Use it to create controlled explosions, or as a really intense piece of string. Your choice, pyromaniac.

BugbearPelt.name: Bugbear Pelt
BugbearPelt.description: The fuzzy remnant of a creature that probably wanted to eat you. Now it's a rug, or a really disturbing coat. Wear it and scare small children!

SubwayTokens.name: Subway Tokens
SubwayTokens.description: Useless currency from a forgotten era. Collect them all and win absolutely nothing! But hey, they make great skipping stones.

BasiliskEyeJelly.name: Basilisk Eye Jelly
BasiliskEyeJelly.description: Scooped fresh from a basilisk's skull. Don't make eye contact unless you fancy being a lawn ornament. Great for petrifying potions or the world's most dangerous jello shots.

UnicornHornShavings.name: Unicorn Horn Shavings
UnicornHornShavings.description: Magical dandruff from the forehead of a unicorn. Snort it for rainbow-colored boogers and a temporary +2 to your purity stat. Side effects may include spontaneous glitter vomit.

MermaidScales.name: Mermaid Scales
MermaidScales.description: For when you want your armor to sing sea shanties. Grants water breathing, but also an irresistible urge to comb your hair with a fork. Don't ask why.

ChimeraLiver.name: Chimera Liver
ChimeraLiver.description: Three livers in one convenient package! Perfect for brewing potions or surviving a night of Rev-Up Toilet-Grade Moonshine. Warning: May cause spontaneous growth of extra heads.

ManticoreStinger.name: Manticore Stinger
ManticoreStinger.description: Nature's own poison dispenser. Prick your enemies or use it as the world's most dangerous toothpick. Either way, someone's day is about to get real bad, real fast.

HydraBlood.name: Hydra Blood
HydraBlood.description: A cocktail of conflicting blood types. Each drop argues with the others. Use for multi-colored fireworks or the worst case of multiple personality disorder you've ever seen.

CockatriceFeathers.name: Cockatrice Feathers
CockatriceFeathers.description: Plucked from the ass of a cockatrice. Use them to make a quill that turns your writing to stone, or the world's most uncomfortable pillow. Your choice, weirdo.

MinotaurHornPowder.name: Minotaur Horn Powder
MinotaurHornPowder.description: Snort for instant chest hair and the ability to navigate IKEA without a map. Side effects include an inexplicable craving for grass and a tendency to charge at the color red.

DragonHeartstring.name: Dragon Heartstring
DragonHeartstring.description: Still warm and occasionally beating. Use it to string a bow that shoots flaming arrows or as nightmare fuel for your local cardiologist. Caution: May try to restart the dragon.

PhoenixAsh.name: Phoenix Ash
PhoenixAsh.description: The remains of a phoenix... for now. Keep in a fireproof container unless you want a surprise bird in your face. Makes one hell of an antacid.

KrakenInk.name: Kraken Ink
KrakenInk.description: Write invisible messages or create the world's most terrifying calamari. Do not use as printer ink unless you want your résumé to smell like Cthulhu's armpit.

GorgonsTear.name: Gorgon's Tear
GorgonsTear.description: Collected from the eye of a weeping gorgon. Harder than diamonds and saltier than your ex. Do not consume unless you want your insides to become modern art.

DjinnEssence.name: Djinn Essence
DjinnEssence.description: Bottled wishes with more catches than a lawyer's contract. No, you can't wish for more wishes. And no, "I wish you'd let me wish for more wishes" doesn't work either. Nice try, smartass.

WraithVapor.name: Wraith Vapor
WraithVapor.description: Bottled depression with a hint of existential dread. Inhale for instant goth makeover. Warning: May cause uncontrollable desire to listen to My Chemical Romance.

TarrasqueScale.name: Tarrasque Scale
TarrasqueScale.description: A single scale from the apocalypse lizard itself. Use as indestructible armor or the world's most hardcore guitar pick. Do not feed to pets unless you want a kaiju problem.

BeholderEyeStalk.name: Beholder Eye Stalk
BeholderEyeStalk.description: Still twitching and ready to unleash random magical bullshit. Do not use as a back scratcher unless you're prepared for sudden teleportation, petrification, or spontaneous yodeling.

LeviathanAmbergris.name: Leviathan Ambergris
LeviathanAmbergris.description: Whale vomit from the deepest, darkest parts of the ocean. Worth more than your soul and smells like it too. Use as a fancy perfume or to summon Lovecraftian horrors. Dealer's choice.

LichPhylacteryDust.name: Lich Phylactery Dust
LichPhylacteryDust.description: The ground-up remains of a lich's soul jar. Snorting this is like playing Russian roulette with your soul. May cause uncontrollable desire to build giant trap-filled tombs.

AstralDreadnoughtTooth.name: Astral Dreadnought Tooth
AstralDreadnoughtTooth.description: A tooth the size of a longsword from a creature that eats reality for breakfast. Makes one hell of a letter opener or the world's most impractical shiv. Try not to think about the size of its dentist.

PitFiendHeartblood.name: Pit Fiend Heartblood
PitFiendHeartblood.description: Liquid evil in a bottle. Consumption may result in sudden alignment change, spontaneous combustion, or the irresistible urge to run for public office.

SolarFeather.name: Solar Feather
SolarFeather.description: A single feather that outshines the sun. Do not use as a quill unless you want your words to literally come to life and probably smite you. Makes for a great nightlight though.

TimeElementalSand.name: Time Elemental Sand
TimeElementalSand.description: Each grain is from a different era. Mix them wrong and you might erase yourself from existence or end up as your own grandpa. Temporal paradoxes sold separately.

DemilichSkullGem.name: Demilich Skull Gem
DemilichSkullGem.description: A gem that used to house the soul of a demilich. Now it just looks pretty and occasionally whispers ancient secrets or bad puns. 50/50 chance of either.

PrismaticDragonScale.name: Prismatic Dragon Scale
PrismaticDragonScale.description: Changes color based on the viewer's mood. It's like a mood ring, but actually works and is worth more than your entire bloodline. Do not use while playing poker.

NightwalkerShadowEssence.name: Nightwalker Shadow Essence
NightwalkerShadowEssence.description: Bottled darkness from the Negative Plane. Opens a portal to the void when uncorked. Perfect for dramatic exits, world-ending rituals, or hiding from your responsibilities. Use responsibly. Or don't. See if I care.
